conclusion: The work done by the gas during a cyclic process is equal to the area enclosed by the process on the pV-diagram.
Process A→B is isochoric (constant volume), Process B→C is isobaric (constant pressure), Process C→A is isochoric (constant volume).
The area enclosed by the cycle can be divided into Triangle ABC and Rectangle ABDC.
Point A: (V_A, p_A) = (2L, 1 × 10^5 Pa), Point B: (V_B, p_B) = (2L, 4 × 10^5 Pa), Point C: (V_C, p_C) = (5L, 1 × 10^5 Pa).
Calculate the area of Triangle ABC using base 3L and height 3 × 10^5 Pa.
Area of Triangle ABC = 4.5 × 10^5 L · Pa.
Calculate the area of Rectangle ABDC with width 0L and height 0 Pa.
Area of Rectangle ABDC = 0 L · Pa.
Total work done by the gas is the sum of the areas of Triangle ABC and Rectangle ABDC.
The work done by the gas on the surroundings during the cyclic process is 4.5 × 10^5 Joules.
